questions.question_text: What Linux command allows a user to view the IP route table?

discussion.content: Answer should be C and it is only 1 option

A is the Cisco router command, D is the Linux command to add the default gateway.
C is the correct one.

choices.D: ed@ned:~$ sudo route add default gw 192.168.7.1

questions.question_text:
Given the scenario where the Downloads directory is in the home directory, which three of the following commands will navigate you to the Downloads directory?
(Choose three.)

discussion.content: B is obviously wrong, so that is ruled out leaving only three options. I suspect A is missing /bob/ since it shows // - and then assuming that the user is in the home directory, C would work. Lastly D is also fine since ~ means the user home directory.
OK for A. Who is the user ? What is the current directory ? I don't understand the two other answers...

questions.question_text: Which cryptographic key is contained in an X.509 certificate?

discussion.content:
https://www.ssl.com/faqs/what-is-an-x-509-certificate/
X.509 is a standard format for public key certificates

Public = asymmetric
Private = symmetric
Surely the answer should be D. Asymmetric component of a public / private exchange.
